p: Silver nanoparticles have also been assayed for anti-biofilm activity against biofilm-forming bacteria. In the present study, the in vitro anti-biofilm activity of AgNPs was evaluated in a dose-dependent manner against the biofilm- forming bacteria P. aeruginosa, E. coli, and S. aureus. The individual species of bacteria were grown in 96-well microtiter plates for 24 h and then treatments of 10–100 μg/ml of the individually synthesized AgNPs were added to each well. Results of the assay revealed that the biosynthesized AgNPs inhibited biofilm formation by the bacterial species, relative to the negative control used in the experiment ( Figures 7A–C). The MICs of anti-biofilm activity was expressed in terms of IC 50 and all AgNPs, irrespective of which extract was used in their synthesis, exhibited an excellent MIC value against bio-film formation.
